org.apache.juneau.http.response

Class BasicHttpException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • org.apache.juneau.BasicRuntimeException
            • org.apache.juneau.http.response.BasicHttpException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, org.apache.http.HttpMessage, org.apache.http.HttpResponse
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BadRequest, Conflict, ExpectationFailed, FailedDependency, Forbidden, Gone, HttpVersionNotSupported, InsufficientStorage, InternalServerError, LengthRequired, Locked, LoopDetected, MethodNotAllowed, MisdirectedRequest, NetworkAuthenticationRequired, NotAcceptable, NotExtended, NotFound, NotImplemented, PayloadTooLarge, PreconditionFailed, PreconditionRequired, RangeNotSatisfiable, RequestHeaderFieldsTooLarge, ServiceUnavailable, TooManyRequests, Unauthorized, UnavailableForLegalReasons, UnprocessableEntity, UnsupportedMediaType, UpgradeRequired, UriTooLong, VariantAlsoNegotiates

    @BeanIgnore
public class BasicHttpException
extends BasicRuntimeException
implements org.apache.http.HttpResponse
    Basic implementation of the HttpResponse interface for error responses.

    Although this class implements the various setters defined on the HttpResponse interface, it's in general going to be more efficient to set the status/headers/content of this bean through the builder.

    If the unmodifiable flag is set on this bean, calls to the setters will throw UnsupportedOperationException exceptions.

    • Beans are not thread safe unless they're marked as unmodifiable.
    • Overview > juneau-rest-common

      • setReasonPhrase2

        public BasicHttpException setReasonPhrase2(String value)
        Sets the reason phrase on the status line.

        If not specified, the reason phrase will be retrieved from the reason phrase catalog using the locale on this builder.

        Returns:
        This object.

      • setReasonPhraseCatalog

        public BasicHttpException setReasonPhraseCatalog(org.apache.http.ReasonPhraseCatalog value)

      • assertStatusCode

        protected void assertStatusCode(org.apache.http.HttpResponse response)
                         throws AssertionError
        Asserts that the specified HTTP response has the same status code as the one on the status line of this bean.
        Parameters:
        response - The HTTP response to check. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        AssertionError - If status code is not what was expected.

      • getRootCause

        public Throwable getRootCause()
        Returns the root cause of this exception.

        The root cause is the first exception in the init-cause parent chain that's not one of the following:

        • BasicHttpException
        • InvocationTargetException
        Returns:
        The root cause of this exception, or null if no root cause was found.

      • getFullStackMessage

        public String getFullStackMessage(boolean scrubForXssVulnerabilities)
        Returns all error messages from all errors in this stack.

        Typically useful if you want to render all the error messages in the stack, but don't want to render all the stack traces too.

        Parameters:
        scrubForXssVulnerabilities - If true, replaces '<', '>', and '&' characters with spaces.
        Returns:
        All error messages from all errors in this stack.
